intro: Senecio farfarifolius, commonly known as the African Daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow disc flowers surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Senecio farfarifolius is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
